title: At the risk of cluttering the boards even more with the fill/secondary support issue...
body:
**Everyone understands how the system works currently. That's not how people upset with the system want it to work.**
Can we all just move past this single point of friction in the debate?

-Low queue times and diversity are not mutually exclusive traits desired of the fill role. 
-Secondary support players are likely players who actively enjoy the role more than any third option, but don't want it every game.
-Human decision making is hugely influenced by convenience. Even if you can manually game the system to grant you more diversity, the lack of convenience naturally drives players away from the fill/secondary support choices.

The support role may be unattractive to the majority of players, but you can't grow the support role by forcing players to participate in it. That doesn't seem to be helping queue times for non-support players, and it will only get worse as the support pool is distilled to support mains only.

The system as it stands is not working for anyone except support mains like myself who enjoy half-second queues. It's not about blaming anyone for why this has come to be. Long-term work continues to be done to make the support role more attractive, but there is no obvious guaranteed solution for making the role more popular. It's probably half as much a gameplay issue as a social one, to start.

In the short-term the system needs to be tuned better to accommodate the needs of players. The other way around should not and cannot be expected.

replies.body: I really don't think Riot cares. This has been a thing for what, over a month I think? They haven't even said they intend on fixing it.

Of course they care. This single issue is probably one of the most damaging threats to the long-term stability of their game. I don't think Riot needs any motivation to act as fast as they can. I think they may not know how to act. They typically don't comment on issues which are prone to incite panic, especially when they don't have an easy solution forthcoming. 

I think it's pretty safe to say that panic is setting in, though. I think it'll be more useful to get any sort of communication in the future if we can cut through some of the bickering noise and hone our sentiments on what exactly players expect and want from the system instead of trying to either apologize or blame anyone for it.

> [{quoted}](name=Lovely Pants,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j3loxx4W,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-03-20T17:09:00.515+0000)
>
> Of course they care. This single issue is probably one of the most damaging threats to the long-term stability of their game.

I disagree that it is damaging their game MORE than the old pick order Toxic fifth pick = support was. So, it's actually better. The only way Riot can make Support a more desired role is by deleting support and adding a fifth income/exp stream so you don't have this position that is behind on levels and gold every match.

It just isn't that much fun for many people to be 3+ levels and a thousand gold behind everyone while also being an extra 2-3k behind in a practical sense from buying your support item. That's okay. The system allows people who don't enjoy it now to not play it. If you can't see how this is better than the old system, I don't know what to say. A few minutes of extra wait time is a price worth paying to not be toxic fifth pick support 80% of your matches because someone always dodged until you ended up randomly placed fifth.

TL:DR, This new queue system is the best thing Riot has ever done for the game. Except for the fkin dynamic group queue shit. That is literally the worst.

I like the intentions of the new queue. I don't think it's necessarily better when an entire subset of players in the Secondary Support and Fill range are severely neglected even if it gives other dual role mains reliable positions. Statistically with the old system I don't see how you're getting support 80% of the time unless you never ever push for a different position. Even as a fill under the old system, I probably only ended up with that half the time, and as my choice. 

I understand that being taxing for some, nonetheless, but the simple fact that the queue system is rapidly failing to function more as time goes by, despite short-term clarity of choice benefits, should be sending off alarm bells all around. 

Personally, I don't want to see the system reverted either. I want it to be tuned. I don't know if that's the correct answer, but I do agree that there are elements worth preserving in it.

(actually, I don't care about dynamic group queue at all and might hypothesize from a role choice balance perspective it has the potential to alleviate some of the unwanted role syndrome, but that's another big tangent of speculation to go off on).
I feel a higher chance of getting a hex box or key might help for players who pick fill as their secondary role.
I feel dodge is still very heavy now. Due to people only wanting to play a single role...

>They typically don't comment on issues which are prone to incite panic, especially when they don't have an easy solution forthcoming. 

There's also the problem of people taking every little thing they say as gospel, so they don't want to say anything and deal with the backlash if they have to change their plans.

Oh No, they haven't talked about a certain thing in over a month! They must not care, despite obviously being busy with many other aspects of this large and popular game that is played both casually and professionally around the world by millions of players at any given time of day.
Yes. That must be it.

The thing is, because people are always getting support if they put fill or support as a primary, they don't want to play supp every game. Thus they start playing/putting other roles because their bored of going support 10 games in a row. The amount of support players is shrinking and killing itself.

> [{quoted}](name=Lovely Pants,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j3loxx4W,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-03-20T16:18:19.834+0000)
>
> and it will only get worse as the support pool is distilled to support mains only.
> 

This has already happened.

Sincerely, a support secondary who hasn't played support in over 2 months (and doesn't even remember how anymore).

I'm jungle/mid now.
I too jg/mid. I used to fill every game. soon I just  put secondary support as something I started to enjoy. After I'd say at least 120 games of support I'm just fucking done with  being blamed

The even bigger problem is despite how much people *hated* support, anyone Q'ing for support *primary* should get support 100% of the time, right?

_Wrong._

When something like this happens, something's going to be super fishy.
I get something else maybe 20% of the time, usually ADC. Once I got top, panicked and picked Vlad, then felt dirty as I cheesed my way to a victory.
hell, even some support mains are quitting support because they want to play other roles for a bit instead of Support every single game.

Related request: If I put Support primary, which means I want it more than any other role, and Support is needed far more than any other position, how about giving me Support 100% of the time?

I'm happier. One more person that would be given Support when they don't want it when I get another position is happier.

Seems like a win-win to me.

Curious, what is your secondary role? As a support/bot, I can without exaggeration say that I have had 100% support role in the last 80+ games that I have played.

I'm not sure all support primaries actually want this, although it's not an issue since secondary support role now serves the purpose of being a support main with the occasional other role.

> [{quoted}](name=Lovely Pants,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j3loxx4W,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2016-03-20T21:30:47.477+0000)

I queue Support/Mid. If I'm actually forced to Mid, which seems to occur 10-20ish% of the time, I'll play Morgana.

I can't ADC to save my life, so suggesting ADC would be a disaster (edit: on the off chance I actually get it).

I'm assuming that the 10-20% of the time I mid, there's a duo (or more) bot. Picking ADC guarantees you break the combination up.

I just got out of a game where I played as Zilean Support. At the end I was 5 levels under the rest of the team whilst my team was flaming me because I didn't save everyone when they jumped back in. Why couldn't I save everyone? 
1. Lack of Gold.
2. Lack of levels.
3. Lack of items and choices (ties in with lack of gold).
4. Lack of respect from team mates.

I got into a game earlier. I went to roam mid and our mid viegar died. He said "F this" then proceded to quit at level 2. We even got the kill on the enemy Vel Koz but I was blamed because our Viegar died. 

This needs to stop.

This is really becoming a BIG PROBLEM. I as many have quit the supp secondary role because we get supp 100% of the time. It is becoming so bad that people are now queing as supp. and doing troll stuff. I just had a game where i got adc and my supp was.......... Singed who went ghose smite. Tells me he just getting smite to steal camps. Ok w/e lets go. Nope then trolls me and bascially double jungled and left me to 1v2 bot lane as Jhin against a naut corki. As u can imagine i got rocked and cldnt cs. Then on top of that everytime i died he went to my lane pushed it and went back to double jungle. How fun is that. Its not and now ppl are queing supp and troll picking. I might b done with league if this keeps up because this is costing me ranked games and its not fun at all.
I hear these complaints a lot. And I understand them. But that's usually all they are: complaints. They say 'this is a problem!' without offering a solution to said problem.

Easy fix: Literally undo everything they've done to champion select.

Game is instantly better.

But of course Riot won't do that.
Really? Because the people who enjoy being able to guarantee they get, at least, their second best role in ranked would disagree.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j3loxx4W,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2016-03-20T22:26:58.145+0000)
>
> Really? Because the people who enjoy being able to guarantee they get, at least, their second best role in ranked would disagree.

At the cost of 20+ minute queues? I'm betting those people would be in the minority.

And these queue times aren't going to get any shorter as support mains get sick and tired of support and everybody else forgets how to play support as they avoid it like the plague.
You haven't seen the people saying that they'll take even longer queue times for being able to only select one role?

And then we're back to people arguing about roles and troll-picking. I haven't seen a single troll pick or people arguing about what role they want ever since they added the new system, but before it would happen to me every 5 games or so.

> [{quoted}](name=Leetri,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=j3loxx4W,comment-id=000300010001,timestamp=2016-03-20T22:45:34.128+0000)
>
> And then we're back to people arguing about roles and troll-picking. I haven't seen a single troll pick or people arguing about what role they want ever since they added the new system, but before it would happen to me every 5 games or so.

I did not get those very often in the old champion select. Yes there were rude people (what else is new in league?) and sometimes you'd have to work around a dick (or not, if you didn't mind risking whether or not he'd troll, usually they were just bluffing) BUT... I've gotten _just as many_ in this new system. Guys who get in the game, see that they didn't get their primary, and flat out state if you don't swap roles with them they're going to troll. Oh, and none of those guys have been bluffing yet.

That's often the way of things, and we're not working with enough data on our side to fully understand the repercussions of those solutions we do suggest, but that doesn't mean it isn't useful to clarify our position on things and start from there.

Part of the problem I perceive with the conversation as it is going right now is that players are trying to make this a "non-support vs. support" thing, or a "serious player vs. fill player" thing. I'd like to help convince the community a little more towards the view that this is something the player base should be on the same side of in having a concern about, even if our solutions don't necessarily agree.

I said this in another similar thread and I'll say it here again. Simply make the fill position not give the same role to a player twice in a row.

So if I queue up as fill and get assigned jungle, then my next game won't be jungle if I queue up for the fill role.

I don't think there is anyway to make the support role more desirable. By definition it is a role that is going to be somewhat starved of resources. 

The community needs to grow up and stop harassing the support for things beyond his/her control. Give the role the same respect they give to any other role.

The only other thing I can think of is that the next 5 to 6 champs Riot makes are all support and they give them bad ass kits and looks that will make everyone want to play support.

Not sure what additional coding it would require, but I would personally like some similar kind of role weighting to play a part. Others would prefer the entire thing to be reverted, and maybe it's too optimistic of me to think that giving players their primaries more often would alleviate the strain of less wanted roles, but I like several things about the organization of the new queue.

As for the desirability of support, I think it's probably going to have more of a niche appeal no matter what, and that's fine to a degree. Certainly I'm biased as someone who rather likes the support role as is and doesn't want it changed too much. There are definitely some small feel issues like the end-game experience gap and bigger social frustrations that I think can be combated to raise the appeal. The social frustration with working so closely with a stranger in particular is a tough one.
bump. less support. more primary picks.
